cd:Record.cd:Description: Fields responsible for populating the Fixed Header

cd:Integer.cd:Description: 4 digits used to distinguish between versions of a file having the same validity period

cd:Record.cd:Description: Values responsible for populating the main product header

cd:Text.cd:Description: Software version number of processing software. Format: name of processor (up to 10 char) version number (4 char)

cd:Record.cd:Description: Processing parameters for Offline Wind Measurement

cd:Text.cd:Description: String indicating source of AISP data product. If set to 'A2D' equ. 69(b) is used. If set to 'E2S' or any other string equ 69(a) is used.

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Flag indicating whether horizontal or line-of-sight wind should be used. This flag can be set to either "true" or "false". A "true" value indicates that the line of sight wind velocity is computed, and a "false" value indicates that horizontal wind velocity is computed
Minimum number of Mie ground wind measurement bins to validate ground correction factor

cd:Float.cd:Description: Threshold applied to coadded gound signal of a measurement if the surface indicates land surface. If the threshold is met, the signal is added to the sum of the ground signal on observation level

Threshold applied to coadded gound signal of a measurement if the surface indicates water/sea ice surface. If the threshold is met, the signal is added to the sum of the ground signal on observation level
Threshold applied to a bin identified as ground bin candidate. If the threshold is not met, the signal of the bin is not added to the sum of the ground signal on observation level
Useful signal threshold used to flag Mie SR on measurement level valid/invalid. See also parameter Mie_SR_Useful_Signal_Lower_Threshold_Met

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Minimum number of Rayleigh ground wind measurement bins to validate ground correction factor

cd:Float.cd:Description: Threshold applied to coadded gound signal of a measurement if the surface indicates land surface. If the threshold is met, the signal is added to the sum of the ground signal on observation level

Threshold applied to coadded gound signal of a measurement if the surface indicates water/sea ice surface. If the threshold is met, the signal is added to the sum of the ground signal on observation level
Threshold applied to a bin identified as ground bin candidate. If the threshold is not met, the signal of the bin is not added to the sum of the ground signal on observation level
Maximum height difference that center of detected ground bin is allowed to be above center of DEM intersection bin
Maximum height difference that center of detected ground bin is allowed to be below center of DEM intersection bin

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Flag indicating wether the Rayleigh response correction shall be performed using the array of response errors of the AUX_RRC file or the polynomial fit of the response errors. A 'TRUE' value indicates that the polynomial fit parameters are used.

cd:Float.cd:Description: If CorrectionWith_Error_Respose_Fit is set to TRUE, the root of a polynomial is retrieved in a Newton iteration that uses this iteration stop threshold.
Mie ground correction weighting factor
Rayleigh ground correction weighting factor
Minimum derivative of Mie signal for ground detection
Maximum Mie Response shift for ground detection
Minimum derivative of Rayleigh signal shift forground detection
Maximum Rayleigh Response shift for ground detection
Maximum FWHM of Mie signal for ground detection
Offset between Mie and Rayleigh ground corrections
Weighting parameter for correction of Rayleigh with Mie ground echo
Weighting parameter for Mie harmonic correction
Weighting parameter for Rayleigh harmonic correction
Weighting parameter for correction of Rayleigh with Mie harmonic

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Threshold for the number of bad pulses in each measurement

cd:Float.cd:Description: Threshold for the for the multimode average ratio over an observation
Retrieved wind values above this threshold are flagged invalid

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Flag TRUE/FALSE to indicate whether negative values for the Mie_Measurement_Data should be set to 0.0.
Flag TRUE/FALSE to indicate whether negative values for the Mie_Reference_Pulse should be set to 0.0.
Flag TRUE/FALSE to indicate if the fitted non-linearities should be used for the Mie processing instead of non-linearities of the input AUX_MRC_1B
Number of sampling points for the Mie non-linearities for the internal path
Number of sampling points for the Mie non-linearities for the atmospheric path
Flag TRUE/FALSE to indicate if a constant response value for the internal Rayleigh reference should be used instead of the processed internal Rayleigh reference response.

cd:Float.cd:Description: Constant internal Rayleigh reference response.

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Flag TRUE/FALSE to indicate if a constant response value for the internal Mie reference should be used instead of the processed internal Mie reference response.

cd:Float.cd:Description: Constant internal Mie reference response.

cd:Record.cd:Description: Processing parameters for Dark Current Memory Zone Calibration

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Altitude reported for this Dude_Reference_Height_Bin has to be below 0.0 m to identify DUDE data.

cd:Float.cd:Description: Energy threshold applied to parameter Avg_UV_Energy to identify valid DUDE measurements.
Threshold applied to the absolute zScore values to identify outliers.
If the top of a certain height bin in meters + Altitude_Offset_Margin is above 0 meters, retrieved dark current rates are replaced by the dark current rates of the input DCMZ file.

cd:Integer.cd:Description: If the number of Mie or Rayleigh observations used to retrieve dark current rates is less than the value stated here, the calibration is flagged invalid in the SPH.

cd:Float.cd:Description: Threshold for sun elevation at DEM intersection to remove measurements within the DUDE period during DCMZ correction for the atmospheric range gates
Threshold for sun elevation at DEM intersection to remove measurements within the DUDE period during DCMZ correction for the solar background range gate
Threshold applied to the absolute zScore values to identify outliers for background rate calculation.

cd:Integer.cd:Description: If for a certain background pixel, the number of input measurements for background rate calculation is below the value stated here, the input background value is copied to the output.

cd:Record.cd:Description: Processing parameters for Mie product confidence params SNR and backscatter-ratio

cd:Float.cd:Description: Correction factor for the calculation of the Mie SR with Mie Core 2.
Correction factor for the calculation of the Mie SR with Mie Core 3.

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Summation index for calculation of SNR and backscatter ratio

cd:Float.cd:Description: Coefficient for x^3 in cubic correction of refined SR calculation.
Coefficient for x^2 in cubic correction of refined SR calculation.
Coefficient for x^1 in cubic correction of refined SR calculation.
Coefficient for x^0 in cubic correction of refined SR calculation.
Retrieved refined SR value will only be corrected with the cubic correction, if the refined SR is above or equal to this threshold.
Retrieved refined SR value will only be corrected with the cubic correction, if the refined SR is below or equal to this threshold.
Fraction of the offset contributed to the Mie
Normalised Mie signal

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Number of reference SR values given in SR_Reference_Voigt. Observation_Level_SR_Error_Voigt and Measurement_Level_SR_Error_Voigt are expected to have the same number of values as SR_Reference_Voigt.

cd:Float.cd:Description: Num_SR_Reference_Points_Voigt SR reference values separated by blanks.
Num_SR_Reference_Points_Voigt observation level SR error reference values separated by blanks.
Num_SR_Reference_Points_Voigt measurement level SR error reference values separated by blanks.

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Switch on/off for Mie SNR including DCO and read-out noise

cd:Float.cd:Description: Estimated noise of one DCO pixel at measurement level.
Read-out noise per pixel.

cd:Record.cd:Description: Processing parameters for Mie Core Algorithm

cd:Float.cd:Description: Gaussian width a. This value should be approximately the fringe FWHM
Peak error threshold
Peak error threshold for internal reference path signal

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Maximum number of gaussian iterations

cd:Float.cd:Description: Threshold to switch Mie-Core processing on/off
Starting value for FWHM
Stop threshold for quadratic sum of differences between modeled and measured ACCD counts per pixel

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Maximum number of iterations in Lorentzfit-loop

cd:Float.cd:Description: Upper threshold for FWHM of Lorentz function for quality check
Lower threshold for FWHM of Lorentz function for quality check
Relative threshold for peak height of Lorentz function
Relative threshold for peak height of Lorentz function
Peak location threshold
Stop threshold for Downhill Simplex algorithm merit function

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Maximum number of iterations of Downhill Simplex algorithm
Number of functional evaluations of Lorentz fit function for one pixel

cd:Float.cd:Description: Threshold to switch Mie-Core processing on/off for internal reference path signal
Starting value for FWHM for internal reference path signal

Stop threshold for change of quadratic sum of differences between modeled and measured ACCD counts per pixel: if the difference between the quadratic sum from the previous to the next iteration loop is below this threshold, the iteration is stopped for internal reference path signal
Maximum number of iterations in Lorentz fit-loop for internal reference path signal
Upper threshold for FWHM of Lorentz function for quality check for internal reference path signal
Lower threshold for FWHM of Lorentz function for quality check for internal reference path signal
Relative threshold for peak height of Lorentz function for internal reference path signal
Relative threshold for peak height of Lorentz function for internal reference path signal
Peak location threshold for internal reference path signal
Stop threshold for Downhill Simplex algorithm merit function for internal reference path signal
Maximum number of iterations of Downhill Simplex algorithm for internal reference path signal
Number of functional evaluations of Lorentz fit function for one pixel for internal reference path signal

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Flag showing if the downhill simplex is on or off. If it is off (FALSE) a method using least squares minimization is used instead of DownHill Simplex
Use the EMSR correction values instead of the TOBS correction values for all Mie processing
Use the internal EMSR array to coorect the Mie reference pulses for the non-uniform illumination of the Fizeau.
Run a Voigt fit on the Mie data in addition
Number of spectral sub-samples for Voigt function

cd:Float.cd:Description: Fixed Voigt function FWHM used in the Mie Core 3
Fixed fraction of Lorentzian function of Voigt used in the Mie Core 3

cd:Record.cd:Description: Processing parameters for Rayleigh product confidence params SNR and backscatter-ratio

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Switch on/off for Rayleigh SNR including DCO and read-out noise

cd:Float.cd:Description: Estimated noise of one DCO pixel at measurement level
Read-out noise per pixel

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Define start pixel for useful signal calculation of channel A
Define stop pixel for useful signal calculation of channel A
Define start pixel for useful signal calculation of channel B
Define stop pixel for useful signal calculation of channel B

cd:Float.cd:Description: Signal To Noise Threshold

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Max signal derivative. Maximum valid pixel intensity difference between adjacent CCD pixels
Pixel saturation threshold

If set to FALSE no DCO correction for Lidar mode measurements data and DCMZ/DUDE but still Imaging mode data and internal reference data is DCO corrected. If set to TRUE, the DCO correction is applied for all modes.

If set to FALSE no DCO correction for the calculation of the Mie mean reference pulse of the Measurement data set in WVM mode is performed. If set to TRUE, the DCO correction is applied to each single pulse vefore calculating the mean reference pulse.

If set to TRUE and Use_DCO_Correction_Lidar_Atmos also set to TRUE, a mode mean DCO correction value is calculated for each height bin and the reference pulses. If set to FALSE and Use_DCO_Correction_Lidar_Atmos also set to TRUE, individual DCO correction values are calculated for each measurement per height bin and each individual reference pulse. If Use_DCO_Correction_Lidar_Atmos also set to FALSE, thus if implicit DCO correction is selected, Do_Mode _Mean_DCO_Pre_Processing is set hard coded to FALSE.
The DCO correction uses a mean offset value. If set to TRUE, pixel 1 is used to derive the mean offset value. If set to FALSE pixel 1 is not used.
The DCO correction uses a mean offset value. If set to TRUE, pixel 2 is used to derive the mean offset value. If set to FALSE pixel 2 is not used.
The DCO correction uses a mean offset value. If set to TRUE, pixel 19 is used to derive the mean offset value. If set to FALSE pixel 19 is not used.
The DCO correction uses a mean offset value. If set to TRUE, pixel 20 is used to derive the mean offset value. If set to FALSE pixel 20 is not used.
The DCO correction uses a mean offset value. If set to TRUE, imaging pixel 17 is used to derive the mean offset value. If set to FALSE imaging pixel 17 is not used.
The DCO correction uses a mean offset value. If set to TRUE, imaging pixel 18 is used to derive the mean offset value. If set to FALSE imaging pixel 18 is not used.

cd:Record.cd:Description: Processing parameters for the selection of pixels that shall be DCMZ corrected.

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Switch on/off the selection of Rayleigh pixels that shall be DCMZ corrected

cd:Record.cd:Description: A list of 24 structures with pixel selections per row. The first structure corresponds to the upper most row on the Rayleigh memory zone.

cd:Array.cd:Description: This list contains 16 values, separated by blanks. The 16 values correspond to a specific row of the ACCD in the memory zone. Each value selects via the setting 0 (no correction) or 1 (perform correction) if the specific pixel should be DCMZ corrected. The first value corresponds to the left most useful pixel on the ACCD in a row.

This list contains 16 values, separated by blanks. The 16 values correspond to the Rayleigh background row. Each value selects via the setting 0 (no correction) or 1 (perform correction) if the specific pixel should be DCMZ corrected. The first value corresponds to the left most useful pixel on the ACCD in a row.

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Switch on/off the selection of Rayleigh pixels that shall be DCMZ corrected

cd:Record.cd:Description: A list of 24 structures with pixel selections per row. The first structure corresponds to the upper most row on the Mie memory zone.

cd:Array.cd:Description: This list contains 16 values, separated by blanks. The 16 values correspond to a specific row of the ACCD in the memory zone. Each value selects via the setting 0 (no correction) or 1 (perform correction) if the specific pixel should be DCMZ corrected. The first value corresponds to the left most useful pixel on the ACCD in a row.

This list contains 16 values, separated by blanks. The 16 values correspond to the Mie background row. Each value selects via the setting 0 (no correction) or 1 (perform correction) if the specific pixel should be DCMZ corrected. The first value corresponds to the left most useful pixel on the ACCD in a row.

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Correct Nadir mode measured data for satellite velocity using ideal RRC/MRC response slopes.
Correct Off-Nadir mode measured data for satellite velocity

cd:Float.cd:Description: Time that laser needs to stabilize after a frequency change.

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Correction value to be added to the nominal background integration time.
